messages.content: What is the purpose of ComfyUI-SaveQueues?
ComfyUI-SaveQueues adds a button to the menu to save and load the running queue and the pending queues, allowing users to exit ComfyUI with queues still remaining.
To install ComfyUI-SaveQueues, use the command `git clone https://github.com/pkpkTech/ComfyUI-SaveQueues` in your ComfyUI custom_nodes directory.
What functionality does ComfyUI-SaveQueues add to ComfyUI?
ComfyUI-SaveQueues adds the ability to save and load running and pending queues in ComfyUI.
In what situation would you use ComfyUI-SaveQueues?
ComfyUI-SaveQueues is useful when you want to exit ComfyUI while still having queues remaining.
Where should you clone the ComfyUI-SaveQueues repository?
The ComfyUI-SaveQueues repository should be cloned in your ComfyUI custom_nodes directory.
What is the command to clone the ComfyUI-SaveQueues repository?
The command to clone the ComfyUI-SaveQueues repository is `git clone https://github.com/pkpkTech/ComfyUI-SaveQueues`.
Is ComfyUI-SaveQueues a built-in feature of ComfyUI?
No, ComfyUI-SaveQueues is not a built-in feature of ComfyUI. It is a custom node that needs to be installed separately.
